div.div: Ὄλυμπος, Οὔλυμπος : Olympus, a mountain in Thessaly, not less than nine thousand feet in height, penetrating with snow-capped peaks through the clouds to the sky, and conceived by Homer as the abode of the gods. Epithets, ἀγάννιφος, αἰγλήεις, αἰπυς, μακρός, πολύπτυχος.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
